intro: Spergularia gamostyla, commonly known as the red sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or saline environments. Its ability to tolerate drought and high salinity makes it an important component of coastal ecosystems. Spergularia gamostyla is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
